contentrichtext.text: {{orphan|date=October 2009}} The '''Nuclear Risk Reduction Center''' is part of the [[United States Department of State]]. It has counterpart in Moscow in the [[Russia]]n [[Ministry of Defence (Russia)|Ministry of Defense]]. The NRRC was created in 1987 by an agreement between the [[United States Secretary of State]] and the [[Soviet Foreign Minister]]. Its purpose was to create an additional channel of communication for the prevention of [[nuclear war]], in addition to the [[Moscowâ€“Washington hotline|Hot Line]][http://www.cdi.org/russia/263-12.cfm] and diplomatic channels. The NRRC is online 24 hours a day and relays information regarding the arms activities of both nations so as to prevent accidental outbreak of nuclear war. ==See also== *[[Lists of nuclear disasters and radioactive incidents]] ==External links== *[http://www.fas.org/nuke/control/nrrc/index.html Federation of American Scientists information on the NRRCs in Washington and Moscow] *[http://www.state.gov/t/avc/rls/199564.htm DoS fact sheet on NRRC] [[Category:United States Department of State]] [[Category:Arms control]] [[Category:Nuclear weapons]] [[Category:Cold War history of the United States]] [[Category:1987 establishments in the United States]] {{US-mil-stub}} {{nuclear-weapon-stub}}
